tool.name: MassGradev2

param.name: demInput
param.dialogReference: The raster dataset or mosaic dataset that represents elevation values.
param.pythonReference: Raster should be in a projected coordinate system, preferably State Plane or UTM. Vertical units for the raster much match the horizontal units of the projection.

param.name: xyzUnit
param.dialogReference: Identifies the vertical units of the Input elevation raster (Foot or Meter). Vertical units for the raster much match the horizontal units of the projection

param.name: slopeUnits
param.dialogReference: Defines the units of the slope output: Percent or Degrees. Default: Percent.

param.name: maxSlope
param.dialogReference: The slope limit in percent or degrees. Percent slope should be input as “15” for 15%, not “0.15”

param.name: outputVolume
param.dialogReference: A raster dataset that represents the grading volume for each cell per acre/hectare required to mitigate the slope

param.name: costOption
param.dialogReference: Option to output a raster representing grading cost per acre/hectare

param.name: gradePrice
param.displayname: Cost of grading per cubic yard or cubic meter (optional)
param.dialogReference: The cost of grading per cubic yard or meter. Default: $10

param.name: outputCost
param.dialogReference: A raster dataset that represents the grading cost for each cell per acre/hectare required to mitigate the slope

tool.summary: Creates a heat map of the volume and cost of grading based on the directional slope of a surface
tool.usage:
• While volume and cost estimates can be summarized, the purpose of this tool is to create a heat map of high slopes that will cost more to mitigate.

  • Output is one raster that represents the volume per acre or hectare needed to mitigate slopes over the prescribed limit. An optional output can calculate cost per acre or hectare.

  • This tool is most useful to guide layout design to avoid areas where grading will be problematic.
